fields.title: Harris 1988 School Health Survey, study no. 874024

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This survey was in two parts. Part I focuses on students' knowledge of a range of health related topics. It also attempted to measure what teachers and parents (Part II) perceived as the level of knowledge, attitudes and behavior on the part of the school children. Variables included nutrition, safety, health maintenance programs, smoking, substance abuse, AIDS, and mental and emotional health.

fields.notesText:
Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Students and teachers were interviewed in-person. Parents were interviewed by telephone. Harris telephone surveys use a form of random digit dialing. From a random multi-stage cluster sampling design, they obtain a national cross-section of U.S. adults. Inte
rviewers are usually given the first five digits of a series of randomly selected residential telephone geographic locations, including minor civil divisions. The interviewer then adds two randomly generated digits to complete a new seven-digit number.; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:ACCESS.CATEGORY  Notes: I; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:CODEBOOK.NUMBER  Notes: H-874024;
